# processPool

**Instance Property**

The object that coordinates the processes the web view uses to render its web content and execute scripts.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var processPool: WKProcessPool { get set }
```

## Discussion

When it initializes a web view, WebKit either creates a new web content process in the specified pool, or uses an existing process from that pool.

## Configuring the web view’s behavior

- **websiteDataStore**: The object you use to get and set the site’s cookies and to track the cached data objects.
- **userContentController**: The object that coordinates interactions between your app’s native code and the webpage’s scripts and other content.
- **applicationNameForUserAgent**: The app name that appears in the user agent string.
- **limitsNavigationsToAppBoundDomains**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the web view limits navigation to pages within the app’s domain.
- **upgradeKnownHostsToHTTPS**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the web view should automatically upgrade supported HTTP requests to HTTPS.
